question: Which of the following rulers personal life depicted in the famous Sanskrit work "Navasaha Sankacharitam" of the Sanskrit poetÂ Padmagupta?
explanation:
The Sanskrit poet Padmagupta Parimala composed \"Navasaha Sankacharitam\" , in which he described the exploits of Paramara
King Sindhuraja (995-1010 AD) of Dhara. It deals with the marriage of Sindhuraja (the father of King Bhoja of Dhara) with the Shashi Prabha ( the daughter of Nagaraja Shankhapara) and the personal aspects of his life.
